byline.contributor: Choe Sang-Hun contributed reporting from Seoul, South Korea.

abstract: Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe restates country's official remorse for its actions in World War II in nationally televised address on night before 70th anniversary of war's end; does not offer new apology of his own, breaking from practice of previous Japanese leaders.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Abe’s statement on the eve of the 70th anniversary of the war’s end seemed intended to highlight what he and other conservatives see as an endless apology.

headline.main: Shinzo Abe Echoes Japan’s Past World War II Apologies but Adds None
headline.print_headline: Premier’s Remorse for Japan’s Aggression Stops Short of Apology
